title: John Whaite 'signs off' from social media, saying he's suffering from a 'serious bout of depression'
text:
Former Bake Off star John Whaite has revealed he's stepping away from social media while suffering from a 'severe bout of depression'.

The winner of the 2012 Great British Bake Off received a wave of support from followers on his Twitter account after telling them he was 'signing off'.

Whaite, 30, has been open about his long-term mental health struggles in the past and in August launched a plea on Twitter to help find his 'severely depressed' sister, after she went missing in Portugal for two days.

Scroll down for video

Great British Bake Off 2012 winner John Whaite, 30, has revealed that he's 'signing off' from Twitter while he endures a 'serious bout of depression'

The star, who's been frank about his struggles with mental health, told his 90,000 followers on Tuesday evening that he's taking a break from social media

Whaite's tweet on Tuesday evening; the star said he recognised he needed to sign off social media when he cried at a Balsam Hill Christmas tree advert

The star baker tweeted on Tuesday evening: 'You know you’re going through a serious bout of depression when you eat a full box of Curiously Cinnamon cereal and cry at a Balsam Hill artificial Xmas tree advert... I'm signing off.'

Fans of the star quickly rallied with supportive tweets, urging him to come back soon.

@Loobylou65 urged: 'Don't sign off! Keep talking, keep crying if you need to. We're listening! Xx'

@ZitahM penned: 'Hope there's someone with you in your sign-off so you can talk when you need to.'

@ChazH8593 added: 'Hang on in there John and ride through the storm; feel the love and care that people here are offering you in support. You are definitely not alone.'

Earlier this year, Whaite revealed the impact winning the then BBC cooking show at just 23 had on his mental health.

Although he insisted he'd do it all over again, the former-law student urged this year's hopefuls to 'be careful what you wish for'.

In August, Whaite (pictured during his former cookery spot on Lorraine) revealed that every year following his win on the show his appeal would diminish as new bakers came through

In a column for the Telegraph, he wrote that 'as the next batch of Bake Off starts emerged, my appeal shrank. Year on year, the working days became fewer and financial offers were smaller. The life to which I had become accustomed slowly dissolved.'

In August, the star, from Chorley, Lancashire, made a plea for help on Twitter following the disappearance of his older sibling Victoria Cunningham at Faro airport.

At the time he tweeted: 'My sister has gone missing from Faro Airport. We are all worried for her welfare. Portuguese police aren't interested in helping us search for her.'

Miss Cunningham was eventually found by a stranger, alive but 'very, very distressed'.

John (pictured, left) made an appeal in August after his sister, Victoria Cunningham (pictured, right) went missing in Portugal, later revealing she was found and returned home safely

The TV star shared this desperate plea with his followers on Twitter

Mr Whaite tweeted: 'Sister is home and safe and so it’s now business as usual. Thanks again for all your love and help. If you want more info on PMDD see @viciouscyclepmd.'

Mr Whaite said she was suffering form a hormonal-based illness known as Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder (PMDD).

In a follow up tweet, he said: 'We are now going to focus on getting her home and back in good health in the privacy and protection of our family.

'My gratitude to each one of you is undying. You've helped save a sister, a daughter and a mother - thank you.'
description: The 2012 Bake Off star took to social media on Tuesday to say that he was suffering with a 'serious bout of depression' telling his 90,000 followers 'I'm signing off'.
